title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1716/86 of 2 June 1986 fixing for the 1986/87 marketing year the minimum purchase price for lemons delivered to the industry and the amount of financial compensation payable after their processing
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 1716/86
of 2 June 1986
fixing for the 1986/87 marketing year the minimum purchase price for lemons delivered to the industry and the amount of financial compensation payable after their processing
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. The minimum price referred to in Article 1 (3) of Regulation (EEC) No 1035/77 for the 1986/87 marketing year, the price shall be as follows:
(ECU/100 kg net)
1.2.3 // Spain   // Portugal   // Other Member States   //  //   //   // 11,21   // 11,76   // 20,03   //    //   //
2. The minimum price shall be in respect of products ex-producer's packaging station.

The amount of the financial compensation referred to in Article 2 of Regulation (EEC) No 1035/77 for the 1986/87 marketing year shall be as follows:
(ECU/100 kg net)
1.2.3 //  //  //  // Spain   // Portugal   // Other Member States   //    //   //   // 2,86   // 3,41   // 11,68   //  //   //

1. Notwithstanding Article 7 (1) of Regulation (EEC) No 1562/85, contracts for the first part of the 1986/87 marketing year may be concluded until 31 July 1986.
2. Notwithstanding Article 7 (2) of Regulation (EEC) No 1562/85, supplementary agreements to the contracts referred to in paragraph 1 may be concluded until 30 September 1986.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
It shall apply with effect from 1 June 1986.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 2 June 1986.
For the Commission
Frans ANDRIESSEN
Vice-President
